    | timestamp = 00:13:21.519
    | text      = It is very important again to mention that Alex is saying that they hide their teeth
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:25.759
    | text      = and wings so they don't scare you.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:27.759
    | text      = That is an important thing for them to do.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:29.440
    | text      = That is important.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:30.159
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:30.480
    | text      = So hold on to that thought as we jump in.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:32.960
    | text      = So Alex is stupid.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:34.240
    | text      = He doesn't, he's never read Plato.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:35.440
    | text      = That's what I'm saying.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:36.240
    | text      = Hold on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:36.639
    | text      = Quick question.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:37.279
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:37.519
    | text      = Are you hiding your teeth and wings from me?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:39.679
    | text      = I'm not, but we will get into where he gets that idea from in this next clip.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:44.960
    | text      = The veneer of civilization is almost gone, the purposeful take down of the planet, right
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:52.720
    | text      = as we prepare to go to jump point, not just to the stars, but to other dimensions.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:57.519
    | text      = Jump point alpha?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:13:58.480
    | text      = The establishment's obsessed with the technology they've got.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:00.720
    | text      = They're obsessed with the breakaway civilization, but they've got life extension.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:03.919
    | text      = They've already got everything for all intents and purposes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:07.360
    | text      = They found forms of immortality and they're able to push off death.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:11.440
    | text      = So far, they believe they'll have true immortality within 50 years.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:15.039
    | text      = And so we're just an afterthought.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:19.440
    | text      = You see, globalism was always meant to fail, but for the acolytes, the sub level, not the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:27.519
    | text      = actual elite, but the sub-oids, the professors, the technicians, they believe they're taking
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:32.639
    | text      = over the earth to save the planet.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:34.000
    | text      = And it's their right to rule and organize society.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:36.240
    | text      = That's why they're going to reduce population.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:37.919
    | text      = If you're just a kind of a mid-level person, you're told 80%.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:40.240
    | text      = If you're higher level, you're told 90%.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:42.879
    | text      = If you're really high level, you're told 99% of humans will be taken out.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:46.799
    | text      = And if you're in that maybe 2,000 people that have been given the whole ball of wax, the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:50.720
    | text      = whole picture, you're told humans are an abomination.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:54.799
    | text      = Of course.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:14:55.440
    | text      = And our God says he will give us the codes to merge with silicon and truly live forever
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:00.720
    | text      = with him.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:01.440
    | text      = That sounds fun.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:02.799
    | text      = And be uploaded to the consciousness and then move on to the next planet.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:06.399
    | text      = You're like, wait a minute, I read an Arthur C. Clark book called childhood's end that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:10.320
    | text      = the whole media pushed and loved.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:12.000
    | text      = And it was so good.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:13.279
    | text      = And the whole wonderful Arthur C. Clark was in the real Illuminati groups that they just
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:22.080
    | text      = use Crowley to put out some of their info naturally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:25.679
    | text      = He was in MI6, OSS before that total highest level.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:31.120
    | text      = So see, you read those books, you watch those movies and let me explain something to you.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:35.759
    | text      = They're telling you how the cow ate the cabbage.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:38.399
    | text      = You understand?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:39.519
    | text      = With his mouth?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:41.919
    | text      = They're telling you how the cow ate the cabbage.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:45.919
    | text      = Alex loves that expression.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:47.600
    | text      = So Jordan, that clip made me feel like a fool in a way that few Alex Jones clips ever have
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:53.679
    | text      = simply because it made me remember something I'd forgotten and that I really should have
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:57.600
    | text      = remembered.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:15:58.799
    | text      = I read childhood's end, the 1953 sci-fi novel by Arthur C. Clark back in junior high.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:04.320
    | text      = But unfortunately, the details are a little bit murky in my mind.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:08.000
    | text      = I remember that it was about an alien invasion that was benevolent that led to the destruction
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:11.840
    | text      = of the planet.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:12.639
    | text      = But past that, it was kind of a little bit gray.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:15.039
    | text      = So when Alex brought up the book in that clip, I decided that maybe I needed to revisit the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:18.960
    | text      = text.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:19.600
    | text      = And when I did, I realized that Alex very well may be basing most of his worldview and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:24.320
    | text      = his conception of the power behind the globalists on childhood's end.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:27.919
    | text      = Have you ever read it?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:28.879
    | text      = No, I have not read it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:29.759
    | text      = Okay, good.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:31.279
    | text      = I wasn't a big Arthur C. Clark guy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:33.039
    | text      = I wasn't a huge fan either.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:34.240
    | text      = But I wasn't totally huge on sci-fi as I got into late junior high, into high school.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:41.519
    | text      = That wasn't sort of my cup of tea.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:43.759
    | text      = But I had read...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:44.559
    | text      = I was a vociferous reader when I was younger.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:47.519
    | text      = But unfortunately, because I read a lot of things before I was probably old enough to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:52.240
    | text      = really internalize a lot of them, I've lost my memory of a ton of shit I read.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:56.879
    | text      = And childhood's end was one of them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:16:58.240
    | text      = But I just read it yesterday because I was like, I need to get into this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:02.000
    | text      = I need to see what Alex is talking about.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:03.919
    | text      = So if you haven't read it, and spoiler alert here for childhood's end, the book is about...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:09.279
    | text      = It ends childhood.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:10.400
    | text      = It does.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:11.440
    | text      = So also there's a sci-fi network series based on it that was apparently disappointing a
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:16.880
    | text      = couple of years back.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:18.079
    | text      = But the book is about a future where the countries of Earth are at the brink of nuclear war by
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:22.400
    | text      = way of militarizing space race, which promises to destroy the planet.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:27.200
    | text      = Before the trigger could be pulled, alien ships appear and the nuclear war gets put
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:30.880
    | text      = on the back burner.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:31.920
    | text      = These aliens say that they're going to be supervising Earth to make sure that we don't
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:35.200
    | text      = bring extinction upon ourselves.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:36.880
    | text      = And since there are a ton of spaceships over major cities, humanity goes along with the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:40.640
    | text      = plan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:41.519
    | text      = The aliens, called the Overlords, are in charge of the major issues of the world, but they're
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:45.920
    | text      = not enslaving humanity at all.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:47.920
    | text      = The only direct interference that they have are in international relations issues.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:53.359
    | text      = And other than that, outside of the sphere of international relations, they only interfere
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:56.960
    | text      = twice in humanity's affairs.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:17:59.200
    | text      = Wants to outlaw bullfighting because it's a barbaric practice and wants to relieve the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:03.519
    | text      = persecution of the white minority in post-apartheid South Africa.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:07.279
    | text      = Because at the time that he wrote this book, there was the perception of apartheid is going
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:12.559
    | text      = to end and then it's all going to be flipped and the white minority there is going to be
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:16.319
    | text      = brutally repressed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:17.359
    | text      = Oh, if only.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:18.160
    | text      = And so he imagined that being the state of it and these aliens, the Overlords that Arthur
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:22.960
    | text      = C. Clark had conceived of, would think that that was such an inhumane situation that they
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:28.160
    | text      = would try and rectify things.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:30.720
    | text      = And unsurprising that the alien race known as the Overlords would be supporting the Swede
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:36.319
    | text      = Landers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:37.200
    | text      = A little bit on the nose there.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:38.720
    | text      = I think, but that's a future he didn't know.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:42.160
    | text      = I know, I know, it's just fun.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:45.279
    | text      = So the Overlord supervisor, Carolyn, only speaks directly to the Secretary General of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:50.160
    | text      = the United Nations, which is where we get one of our first connections to Alex's worldview.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:54.480
    | text      = Alex believes that the globalists, among whom the leadership of the UN are bigwigs, they
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:18:58.880
    | text      = take their orders from an off-world race, an idea that is a very basic piece of childhood's
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:04.640
    | text      = end and the storyline thereof.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:07.119
    | text      = Though Carolyn speaks to the Secretary General, he won't allow him to see his physical form.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:12.640
    | text      = The Secretary General presses on the issue saying that humanity won't be horrified of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:16.319
    | text      = them and likely won't fully trust the Overlords if they can't see them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:20.400
    | text      = Carolyn discusses the idea with his superiors and decides to promise to show their true
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:25.359
    | text      = form to humanity after 50 years, a point at which humans will have gotten used to the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:29.839
    | text      = Overlords being around and it won't be so shocking for them to see their true form.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:34.880
    | text      = Those naive Overlords.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:36.640
    | text      = When the time comes, the Overlords appear to man and they look exactly like the traditional
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:41.440
    | text      = image of demons.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:42.880
    | text      = This is the second direct mirror to Alex's worldview.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:45.519
    | text      = He believes that off-world entities that are giving orders to the globalists are actually
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:49.359
    | text      = demons who don't want you to think that they're demons.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:51.680
    | text      = We heard it earlier in that clip where he said they're hiding their teeth and wings
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:55.440
    | text      = so you don't see and you don't get afraid.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:19:57.839
    | text      = That tension, the concept of masking the image of looking like a demon to gain people's
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:02.079
    | text      = trust is an idea that he almost certainly lifted wholesale from this book.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:06.240
    | text      = Almost entirely.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:07.279
    | text      = That's fascinating.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:08.319
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:08.640
    | text      = And it gets weirder.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:10.160
    | text      = Do you know it's a weird coincidence?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:12.480
    | text      = I remember this now.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:13.599
    | text      = The Secretary General in Childhood's End is Ban Ki-moon.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:19.599
    | text      = Isn't that crazy?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:20.880
    | text      = He got that one right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:22.079
    | text      = It was so weird.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:22.960
    | text      = It's Ricky Stormbane or something like that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:27.359
    | text      = All right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:27.680
    | text      = I can't remember exactly his last name.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:29.440
    | text      = Stormbringer.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:30.079
    | text      = Yeah, it's very close.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:32.160
    | text      = So the Overlords guide humanity through a number of years of prosperity and peace, but
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:36.000
    | text      = ultimately mankind feels uninspired and like they're losing something that makes them
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:39.759
    | text      = vibrant.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:40.640
    | text      = So an artist's colony has established an opposition to the Overlords, although the Overlords
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:45.200
    | text      = don't really care that people are doing it, on an island called New Athens.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:49.440
    | text      = The colony is supposed to be a utopian place where humanity can thrive, but ultimately
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:53.759
    | text      = the inhabitants there blow themselves up with a nuclear bomb, which I think is where Alex
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:20:57.599
    | text      = is getting his ideas about what happened to Atlantis from that we heard earlier in this
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:01.519
    | text      = episode.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:01.920
    | text      = Oh boy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:02.799
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:03.359
    | text      = If only he was really into Beneath the Planet of the Apes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:06.799
    | text      = That would be more fun.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:07.839
    | text      = I'm not saying he's not.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:08.880
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:09.119
    | text      = He might be.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:09.680
    | text      = I mean, if he had an unexploded nuclear bomb underneath his house that he worshipped, that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:13.839
    | text      = would make just as much sense as anything else he says.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:16.480
    | text      = It could be, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:17.599
    | text      = So I'm skipping over a lot of stuff here, but it ends up being the case that the Overlords
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:21.920
    | text      = aren't necessarily here to help humanity as much as they are here to usher us into the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:26.720
    | text      = next phase of our evolution.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:28.720
    | text      = They serve the orders of something called the Overmind, which is a godlike entity that's
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:32.880
    | text      = made up of ascended elements of other species from throughout the planet.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:36.640
    | text      = Oh, sorry, throughout the universe, all kinds of other planets.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:39.759
    | text      = The Overlords' mission was to facilitate the inevitable ascension of humanity into the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:44.319
    | text      = Overmind.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:45.200
    | text      = They're the cosmic midwives, unable to ascend into the Overmind themselves, only able to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:50.640
    | text      = experience the divine process vicariously.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:53.599
    | text      = This also mirrors Alex's ideas about the globalists lacking some spark that humanity has, something
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:58.799
    | text      = that they envy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:59.680
    | text      = It's not so clear from the text that the Overlords are particularly mad or jealous of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:06.160
    | text      = humanity's ability to become one with the Overmind, but knowing Alex's psychology, it's
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:10.720
    | text      = easy to see how he would project that onto these characters in the book.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:14.079
    | text      = Yeah, of course.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:14.559
    | text      = That they're somehow bitter about the fact that they can't become one with the Overmind,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:18.079
    | text      = they just have to serve the Overmind and help us become one with the Overmind.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:22.400
    | text      = And it's not like a manipulation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:24.559
    | text      = That was something that was going to happen.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:26.319
    | text      = That that ascendance was happening one way or the other.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:29.839
    | text      = They were just there to help the process go smoothly.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:33.200
    | text      = They're not doing it to us or something like that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:36.000
    | text      = But Alex, as a suspicious guy, could easily read the book and be like, they did that shit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:41.920
    | text      = They knew it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:42.720
    | text      = They made the kids psychic.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:43.920
    | text      = I think that's one of the reasons that I was never a big Arthur C. Clarke fan, is the lack
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:48.880
    | text      = of creative naming.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:50.319
    | text      = Like the overlords, the Overmind, what day is it?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:56.880
    | text      = You're asking me the overtime.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:59.279
    | text      = It's all going to be there.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:00.319
    | text      = But he also cribbed a lot of these ideas from another book from the 1930s that someone else
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:04.640
    | text      = wrote or expanded on the ideas that he had read other places.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:09.200
    | text      = It's not like outright theft or anything like that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:10.960
    | text      = No, no, no, no.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:11.759
    | text      = I think the book was good.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:12.799
    | text      = I enjoyed it and everything, but I also thought it had some structural problems.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:18.160
    | text      = It's not the best book ever.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:19.680
    | text      = Even best sci-fi book.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:20.960
    | text      = But some of the ideas I think are really interesting and worth exploring.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:25.359
    | text      = So anyway, the becoming one with the Overmind happens because the children of Earth begin
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:29.839
    | text      = to express psychic abilities that evolve pretty quickly, and they become more and more of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:34.000
    | text      = a unified entity.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:35.200
    | text      = All of these individual children become one.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:37.920
    | text      = The sort of metaphor that they use is the idea of like islands, while the ocean is there,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:42.240
    | text      = appear to be separate things.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:43.440
    | text      = But if the ocean disappears, you see them as connected through the bottom of the ocean.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:48.880
    | text      = You see that all the islands are actually the same landmass.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:52.240
    | text      = That's what happens to these children.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:53.599
    | text      = They all become one and become completely a different thing than the rest of humanity.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:58.400
    | text      = Well, that's fun.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:59.519
    | text      = The Overlords are not doing this to the children.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:01.680
    | text      = They are just there to usher through the process that's happening with or without them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:05.359
    | text      = However, the misrepresentation that they're somehow affecting the children of Earth is
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:08.640
    | text      = completely in line with Alex's beliefs about how the globalists are targeting the children
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:12.640
    | text      = and trying to change them through the water, through hormones, these sorts of things.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:16.640
    | text      = And all the attacks on the children and the family very clearly mirrored in a misreading
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:22.960
    | text      = of childhood's end.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:23.920
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:24.640
    | text      = In the end, the Earth is destroyed, not by the Overlords, by the way, but the Earth is
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:30.480
    | text      = destroyed, and the children mature enough to ascend into oneness with the Overmind.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:34.880
    | text      = The Overlords move on to await their next mission from the Overmind, the next species
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:39.599
    | text      = that they'll be tasked with aiding in their ascension.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:42.160
    | text      = The last human, Jan Roderix, escapes the chaos on Earth by stowing away in a supply ship
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:47.839
    | text      = that goes back to the Overlords' planet.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:50.079
    | text      = There, he has a conversation with some of the aliens about what's going on and realizes
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:54.240
    | text      = there's nothing left for him at all.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:56.240
    | text      = He has no hope of ascending with the evolved children.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:58.880
    | text      = There are no more humans left, and he can't very well become an Overlord, or what kind
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:02.880
    | text      = of an existence would he have if he just went along with them to the next planet that they
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:07.279
    | text      = go " and they're functionally immortal, like the Overlords live forever, he wouldn't
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:12.880
    | text      = even make it to the next planet, probably.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:14.799
    | text      = So he has nothing left.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:16.480
    | text      = So he decides to witness the end of Earth, the end of the planet, and report back to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:20.640
    | text      = the Overlords about the experience as it happens, because they have cameras watching the planet,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:26.160
    | text      = but they don't know experientially what it's like for the end of the planet to happen.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:29.920
    | text      = So he's staying on the planet in order to experience the destruction of the planet.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:35.039
    | text      = And because he realizes that the Overlords weren't some sort of nefarious force, he's
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:39.599
    | text      = giving them whatever information could be helpful to them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:42.559
    | text      = Yeah, sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:43.119
    | text      = So that's how he decides to die.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:45.279
    | text      = Everybody has a purpose.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:46.559
    | text      = But before that happens, he has this exchange with Rasha Varek, another one of the Overlords.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:52.799
    | text      = Quote, tell me this then, Jan said.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:55.119
    | text      = Here's something else you've never explained.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:57.279
    | text      = When your race first came to Earth back in the distant past, what went wrong?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:01.680
    | text      = Why had you become the symbol of fear and evil to us?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:05.440
    | text      = Rasha Varek smiled.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:06.880
    | text      = He didn't do this as well as Kerelin could, but it was a fair imitation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:10.960
    | text      = Quote, no one ever guessed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:12.559
    | text      = And you see now why we could never tell you.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:15.119
    | text      = There was only one event that could have made such an impact upon humanity.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:18.559
    | text      = And that event was not at the dawn of history, but at the very end.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:22.000
    | text      = Quote, what do you mean, asked Jan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:24.079
    | text      = Quote, when our ships entered your skies a century and a half ago, that was the first
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:28.960
    | text      = meeting of our two races.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:30.640
    | text      = Though, of course, we had studied you from a distance.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:33.119
    | text      = And yet you feared and recognized us as we knew that you would.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:37.039
    | text      = It wasn't precisely a memory.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:38.880
    | text      = You have already had proof that time is more complex than your science ever imagined.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:46.160
    | text      = We call it overtime.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:47.279
    | text      = For that memory was not of the past, but of the future, of those closing years when your
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:52.000
    | text      = race would know everything was finished.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:54.799
    | text      = We did what we could, but it wasn't an easy end.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:57.440
    | text      = And because we were there, we became identified with your race's death.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:01.279
    | text      = Yes, even while it was 10,000 years in the future.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:04.400
    | text      = It's as if a distorted echo had reverberated around the closed circle of time from the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:08.799
    | text      = future to the past.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:10.079
    | text      = Call it not a memory, but a premonition.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:13.519
    | text      = The idea was hard to grasp.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:14.799
    | text      = And for a moment, Jan wrestled with it in silence.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:17.119
    | text      = Yet he should have been prepared.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:18.799
    | text      = He had already received proof enough that cause and effect could reverse in their normal
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:22.640
    | text      = sequence.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:23.759
    | text      = There must be such a thing as racial memory.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:26.160
    | text      = And that memory is somehow independent of time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:28.799
    | text      = To it, the future and the past are one.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:30.960
    | text      = That is why, thousands of years ago, man had already glimpsed a distorted image of the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:34.799
    | text      = overlords through a mist of fear and terror.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:38.319
    | text      = Alex's idea of race memory don't make sense when you think about it being an expression
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:43.440
    | text      = of epigenetics.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:44.799
    | text      = And he always talks about the ideas being something much more complicated and grander
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:48.640
    | text      = than just instincts.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:50.240
    | text      = What he believes doesn't line up with anything real, but it lines up perfectly with a concept
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:54.720
    | text      = expressed in Childhood's End.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:56.480
    | text      = I think that Alex just believes that science fiction books are real.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:59.599
    | text      = And Childhood's End is a giant piece that explains so much of what Alex believes about
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:05.359
    | text      = the entities that are behind the globalists that he's against.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:09.279
    | text      = And I feel really stupid, not stupid, but I wish I had remembered that book better months
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:16.160
    | text      = and months ago as we were going through this, because I think a lot of our confusion could
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:19.680
    | text      = have been dismissed with like, he's just talking about fucking Arthur C. Clarke.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:23.119
    | text      = He just thinks that's real.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:24.240
    | text      = But I think it's reasonable for you to have missed that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:26.799
    | text      = And let me tell you why.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:27.920
    | text      = Because I was like 13 when I read it?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:29.920
    | text      = No, because this adds another book to the list of books that Alex has read.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:34.960
    | text      = And that is a shock every time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:36.799
    | text      = That goes, we went from four to five.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:39.440
    | text      = That's a 25% increase.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:42.240
    | text      = I think he was probably super literate when he was younger.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:44.960
    | text      = Like I don't think, I think that his inability to read or his unwillingness to read is probably
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:49.759
    | text      = a more recent feature of his life.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:52.079
    | text      = I think probably in junior high and high school, he was probably like a really huge science
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:56.559
    | text      = fiction fan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:28:58.640
    | text      = I think that he was a Satanist as well.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:00.720
    | text      = It's true.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:01.519
    | text      = Satanism, science fiction, one in the same.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:04.880
    | text      = The dreams of men.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:05.920
    | text      = That's all Satanism is.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:07.039
    | text      = That's true.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:08.000
    | text      = I think that if we were a little bit more critical of him, I think we would end up finding
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:13.839
    | text      = almost everything that he thinks is real that sounds stupid.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:17.440
    | text      = Is in a sci-fi book from the seventies.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:19.599
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:19.839
    | text      = Or fifties, sixties.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:21.279
    | text      = Like it's just all old science fiction.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:23.359
    | text      = All right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:23.680
    | text      = We got a new book club, Dan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:25.119
    | text      = I think we do.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:25.920
    | text      = Figure out what the hell it is Alex thinks.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:28.160
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:28.559
    | text      = Start with Asimov and move on from there.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:30.960
    | text      = I think Asimov might've been too hard for him.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:29:32.640
    | text      = Might've been, that's possible.

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:34:42.559

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:34:47.119

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:34:51.199
    | text      = that if there's a group of Christians living next to a group of Muslims, or animists I

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:05.679
    | text      = That sounds right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:06.800
    | text      = So that is something that pervades a ton of his rhetoric, not just this clip.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:11.199
    | text      = It's something that is a piece of his worldview that he's expressing in the auspices of discussing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:17.280
    | text      = productivity there, but that's not what this is about.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:20.480
    | text      = And what makes this sentiment that he expresses in this clip particularly fucked up is like
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:24.559
    | text      = you responded to, he uses the example of Rwanda.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:27.199
    | text      = The reason this is a problem is there was that whole genocide thing in Rwanda back in
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:31.760
    | text      = 1994, which was perpetrated by the Hutu against the Tutsi.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:36.320
    | text      = While it's true that some Tutsi were Christian and some were Muslim, the Hutu were a mostly
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:40.639
    | text      = Christian group.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:41.599
    | text      = But the real issue here is not that, and the real issue is this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:45.199
    | text      = The religious aspect of that had very little to do with what happened.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:49.760
    | text      = The campaign of genocide against the Tutsi people was a direct result of Belgian colonialization
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:54.320
    | text      = in central Africa.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:35:55.760
    | text      = When the Belgian took control of Rwanda from Germany after World War I, they found a unified
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:00.320
    | text      = culture that was made up of three distinct groups, the Tutsi, Hutu, and Twa people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:04.800
    | text      = They had differences in physical characteristics and traditional occupations, but they existed
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:08.800
    | text      = as a single group.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:10.320
    | text      = In the days of like let's say 400 years back, the Tutsi and Hutu lived in a symbiotic state.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:15.280
    | text      = The Tutsi herders raised cattle on the land that couldn't be used for crops, and manure
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:19.679
    | text      = from the cattle would multiply the yields of the crops that were raised by the Hutu
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:23.199
    | text      = farmers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:23.679
    | text      = The Belgians saw the differences between the groups as evidence of prevailing theories
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:28.320
    | text      = of the time about ethnic superiority.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:30.880
    | text      = This is to say that the majority Hutu were mostly peasant class, while the Tutsi were
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:35.440
    | text      = mostly cattle herders and thus had more property and had physical characteristics more attractive
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:40.719
    | text      = to the colonizers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:42.239
    | text      = Thus, the Belgians believed that the Tutsi were better people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:45.519
    | text      = They provided education for the Tutsi and established indirect rule over the country
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:49.599
    | text      = through them, though they were a minority of the population, making up only approximately
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:53.599
    | text      = 15% of the country.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:36:56.000
    | text      = In 1926, the Belgians passed the Mordahan law, which made it so only Tutsi could be
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:01.760
    | text      = appointed to positions of power and granted them authority over things like taxation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:06.559
    | text      = The elite among the Tutsi saw the benefits that came from going along with this system
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:10.159
    | text      = that the Belgians had set up, where they were the superior group who wielded all of the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:13.760
    | text      = political power in the country, and thus the ethnic status quo was reinforced internally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:18.480
    | text      = By the 1950s, Hutu empowerment groups began to get organized, such as the Association
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:23.280
    | text      = for Social Promotion of the Masses and the Hutu Social Movement, two groups that would
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:27.679
    | text      = combine in 1959 into the Parti du movement de l'Emancipation Hutu, the party of the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:34.639
    | text      = movement for the emancipation of the Hutu.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:37.360
    | text      = Naturally, this made the Tutsi elites a little bit nervous, so they started their own group,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:41.199
    | text      = the Union Nationale Rouands, which would begin clashing with the Hutu groups, inevitably,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:48.480
    | text      = of course.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:49.840
    | text      = The clashes became violent, and many Tutsi went into exile, whereupon largely Hutu Rwanda
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:55.280
    | text      = voted for its independence in 1962.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:37:58.239
    | text      = From this point onward, the Tutsi that remained in Rwanda were a harshly repressed minority,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:02.960
    | text      = and those who fled before independence viewed themselves as refugees from their homeland
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:07.199
    | text      = and began launching guerrilla attacks from across the borders of Zaire, Uganda, and Tanzania.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:12.320
    | text      = Part of this was probably motivated by the fact that many of the Tutsi weren't trusted
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:16.639
    | text      = in the countries that they fled to, where they found themselves unable to successfully
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:20.320
    | text      = start a new life and wanted to go back.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:22.880
    | text      = The Ugandan governments of both Milton Obote and Idi Amin established rules that made the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:28.719
    | text      = Rwandan refugees second-class citizens, they were subject to arbitrary detention by the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:33.039
    | text      = police, and were scapegoated for domestic problems, which only exacerbated their desire
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:37.679
    | text      = to go back home.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:39.199
    | text      = Between 1987 and 1990, the Tutsi group, called the Rwandese Patriotic Front, the RPF, attempted
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:47.679
    | text      = to negotiate a quote, unconditional return of all Rwandan refugees and to accord all
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:52.480
    | text      = Rwandese equal rights.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:38:55.199
    | text      = The Hutu president, Habari Mani, said that the country was full and would accept no more
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:00.880
    | text      = people, so the RPF took up arms.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:03.920
    | text      = Interestingly, when Trump visited the border this past Friday, he said of immigrants and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:08.159
    | text      = refugees, quote, we can't take any more of you, our country is full.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:12.000
    | text      = Very similar rhetoric that does never, it never seems to exist in good places.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:16.800
    | text      = The fighting went on for three years and the RPF was on the verge of victory when foreign
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:20.800
    | text      = forces intervened to save the Habari Mani government.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:24.639
    | text      = These forces ironically included the Belgians, who 60 years prior had set up a brutally pro-Tutsi
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:30.079
    | text      = social structure, only now to be militarily aiding the Hutu government in repulsing the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:34.639
    | text      = Tutsi from returning to the country.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:37.599
    | text      = They don't give a fuck.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:38.880
    | text      = These people do not care at all.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:41.199
    | text      = Colonialism isn't great.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:42.880
    | text      = On April 6th, 1994, President Habari Mani, his private jet was shot down near Kigali
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:49.280
    | text      = Airport.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:50.000

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:51.679
    | text      = The Tutsi claimed that the Hutu extremists themselves shot down the plane as a false
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:55.920
    | text      = flag against the Tutsi.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:57.119
    | text      = Of course.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:39:57.599
    | text      = To this day, it still remains an open question, although there's pretty strong indications
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:01.440

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:05.280
    | text      = bullshit and the RPF probably did it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:07.760
    | text      = Almost certainly.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:08.960
    | text      = Regardless, what happened next is much less an open question to history.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:12.880
    | text      = In the next 100 days, between 800,000 and 1 million Tutsi were slaughtered by the Rwandese
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:19.519
    | text      = army as well as the government-backed civilian militia, the Interhamwe.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:24.159
    | text      = Some estimates claim that 7 out of 10 Tutsi citizens were murdered in the genocide of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:28.960
    | text      = 1994, and that doesn't even count the 10,000 Twa people who were murdered, which made up
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:33.920

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:38.320
    | text      = the Twa were aiding and abetting the RPF.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:40.480
    | text      = Of course.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:41.280
    | text      = Of course they did.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:42.400
    | text      = This piece of history is unspeakably horrible, and the consequences of what transpired are
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = the direct result and indirect result of colonialist systems that were put in place by the Belgians.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:40:51.840

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:03.599

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:06.880
    | text      = Now we also gotta take into consideration about what the Belgians did to the Congo,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:10.800

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:23.280
    | text      = Officers in his army weren't allowed to waste ammunition, because it was really expensive
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:27.440
    | text      = back then, so they needed to prove that each bullet they used was used appropriately.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:32.559

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:37.280

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:39.119

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:46.400
    | text      = thus the scourge of bodily mutilation of Congolese citizens began.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:50.480
    | text      = The practice got pretty out of control, and a lot of innocent people were subjected to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:53.840
    | text      = arbitrary bodily mutilation at the hands of the ostensibly Christian colonialist forces.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:41:59.199

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:08.480

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = Ultimately, however, the legacy of the butcher of the Congo has lived on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:42:40.239

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:50.840
    | text      = If his argument that he was trying to make was this, like during Obama's term, Democrats

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:02.359

}}

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:12.600
    | text      = them as becoming more pro-war than Republicans, and the numbers just don't back that up.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:18.119
    | text      = For instance, a June 2011 study from the Pew Research Center asked respondents if they
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:22.600
    | text      = favored the complete removal of troops from Afghanistan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:25.720
    | text      = 67% of Democrats were in favor of the removal of troops as compared to 43% of Republicans.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:31.560
    | text      = This study is great because it actually has a rebuttal for Alex's likely, like first
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:35.640
    | text      = objection to that, I'm not really a Republican.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:38.279
    | text      = Their research included a variable for Tea Party folk, and it turns out that the Tea
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:42.520
    | text      = Party people were even less into troop removal than mainstream Republicans, with 42% only
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:47.800
    | text      = being in favor of troop removal.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:50.199

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:02.840
    | text      = So even that doesn't match.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:04.600
    | text      = In September 2009, Gallup ran a poll looking at the opinions of Obama's proposal to send
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = more troops into Afghanistan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:11.479

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:18.039
    | text      = the plan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:19.079
    | text      = So, Republicans, widely more in favor as of 2009, and that continued to 2011.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:25.479
    | text      = A November 2015 Gallup poll asked respondents, asked if respondents supported sending ground
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:31.640
    | text      = troops to Iraq and Syria.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:33.479
    | text      = 56% of Republicans were in favor of sending troops, as opposed to 37% of Democrats.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:38.920
    | text      = So that doesn't make sense either.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:41.319
    | text      = A 2011 Gallup poll asked if people approved or disapproved of military action in Libya.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:46.760
    | text      = While it's true that 51% of Democrats approved of that one, the number was still lower than
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:51.399
    | text      = the 57% of Republicans who approved of it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:54.359
    | text      = One of the main exceptions I can find is a September 2013 Gallup poll, which asked about
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:59.079
    | text      = support for a military strike against Syria.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:01.640
    | text      = In this instance, 45% of Democrats were in favor, compared to only 31% of Republicans.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:08.119
    | text      = It's interesting that this is the one instance where Republicans were pretty clear the anti-war
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:11.880
    | text      = as compared to Democrats.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:13.479
    | text      = And I'm pretty sure that there's a cool reason for that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:21.399
    | text      = But as for the Democratic support for the war, if you want to call 45% like outright
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:26.279
    | text      = support for it, fine.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:27.560

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:28.359
    | text      = But if you're looking for an explanation, I think there's a perfectly reasonable one.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:32.119
    | text      = Obama was seeking congressional approval for the action in Syria, as opposed to just attacking
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:37.239
    | text      = them, saying, quote, while I believe I have the authority to carry out this military action
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:41.560
    | text      = without specific congressional authorization, I know that the country will be stronger if
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:45.720
    | text      = we take this course, and our actions will be even more effective.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:49.079
    | text      = At the time of the Gallup poll, the Senate Foreign Relations Committee had passed a resolution
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:53.079
    | text      = authorizing the strike in Syria.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:55.800
    | text      = It seems to me that the higher poll numbers for this attack among Democrats is less indicative
}}

{{TranscriptBlock

    | timestamp = 01:19:00.279

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
